title: Young children who are close to their parents are more likely to grow up kind, helpful and 'prosocial'
description: A loving bond between parents and their children early in life significantly increases the child's tendency to be "prosocial," and act with kindness and empathy towards others, research indicates.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Saving Mt. Wilson Observatory: Inside the long battle to maintain the spot where we found our place in the universe
description: Los Angeles was once the best place in the world to see the universe.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Discovery of invisible nutrient discharge on Great Barrier Reef raises concerns
description: Scientists using natural tracers off Queensland's coast have discovered the source of previously unquantified nitrogen and phosphorous that are having a profound environmental impact on the Great Barrier Reef.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study quantifies satellite brightness, challenges ground-based astronomy
description: The ability to have access to the Internet or use a mobile phone anywhere in the world is taken more and more for granted, but the brightness of Internet and telecommunications satellites that enable global communications networks could pose problems for ground-based astronomy. University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign aerospace engineer Siegfried Eggl coordinated an international study confirming recently deployed satellites are as bright as stars seen by the unaided eye.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: It's time to start worrying about space junk around the moon, too
description: It's getting crowded up there. An increase in military, commercial and scientific launches, coupled with a lower cost for rideshare cubesat launches, means lots more space junk to deal with in coming years. And we're not just talking about low Earth orbit; the moon and cis-lunar (near lunar space) is about to become busy as well.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Humans got to America 7,000 years earlier than thought, new research confirms
description: When and how humans first settled in the Americas is a subject of considerable controversy. In the 20th century, archaeologists believed that humans reached the North American interior no earlier than around 14,000 years ago.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Discovery of massive undersea water reservoir could explain New Zealand's mysterious slow earthquakes
description: Researchers have discovered a sea's worth of water locked within the sediment and rock of a lost volcanic plateau that's now deep in the Earth's crust. Revealed by a 3D seismic image, the water lies two miles under the ocean floor off the coast of New Zealand, where it may be dampening a major earthquake fault that faces the country's North Island.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Toxic storms blamed on climate change cloud Tajikistan
description: The air was dry and warm and the skies over Dushanbe were gray without a hint of sun during another recent toxic sand storm that enveloped the capital of Tajikistan.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
